title: Thousands of Americans stranded in Sudan war zone
description: The U.S. embassy is urging people in Sudan to shelter in place as two rival generals battle for control of the country, leaving 16,000 Americans stranded in the war zone. There are no U.S. plans for a mass rescue mission. NBC News’ Richard Engel and Courtney Kube have the latest.

title: World's best female chef cooks in rhythm with nature
description: Mexico City chef Elena Reygadas, named world's best female chef in The World’s 50 Best Restaurants 2023 awards, focuses on Mexico's biodiversity and history.

title: Temporary cease-fire reached in Sudan, U.S. State Department says
description: A three-day cease-fire will begin in Sudan after multiple days of violence have prompted evacuations of foreign nationals, the U.S.

title: China affirms former Soviet nations’ sovereignty after European outcry
description: The Chinese government said it respects the sovereignty of former Soviet nations after China’s ambassador to France, Lu Shaye, caused an uproar in Europe by questioning the legitimacy of former Soviet states.

title: Spain exhumes fascist leader as it confronts far-right past
description: The remains of Primo de Rivera, a fascist leader who supported General Franco’s dictatorship, were dug up and reburied on Monday, enraging far-right activists as Spain grapples with its complex past.

title: An Indigenous woman from the Amazon wins Goldman Environment Prize
description: Indigenous leader Alessandra Korap won the Goldman Environment Prize for the defense of her Munduruku people's territory in Brazil'sAmazon, helping to halt mining.

title: How one Chinese ambassador's comments set off a wave of European fury
description: China was scrambling Monday to ease European anger over comments by Lu Shaye, Beijing's ambassador to France, that questioned the sovereignty of ex-Soviet states.

title: Dozens of bodies exhumed during cult investigation into Kenya pastor who told followers to starve themselves
description: At least 43 people have died after a pastor in Kenya told his followers at the Good News International Church to fast to death.

title: ‘Dancing With the Stars’ judge Len Goodman dies at 78
description: Len Goodman, the urbane, long-serving judge on “Dancing with the Stars” and “Strictly Come Dancing,” has died, his agent said Monday.

title: Ron DeSantis meets Japan's prime minister during a four-nation trade mission
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis met with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida in Tokyo as part of his four-nation trade mission. The tour, which also includes stops in South Korea, Israel and the U.K., is seen as an attempt to raise his diplomatic profile.

title: Ron DeSantis praises military build-up in visit to Japan
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, a potential U.S. presidential candidate, met with Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Monday as part of a four-country trip.

title: Explorers find WWII ship sunk with over 1,000 Allied POWs
description: A team of explorers said it found a sunken Japanese ship that was transporting Allied prisoners of war in the South China Sea when it was torpedoed in 1942.

title: Sikh separatist leader is arrested in India after long hunt
description: Indian police on Sunday arrested a separatist leader who has revived calls for an independent Sikh homeland and the secession of India’s northern Punjab state.
